greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest sequence such that for all i, j, a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j), where f(n) = gcd(n,usigma(n)) * (-1)^[gcd(n,usigma(n))==n], and usigma is the sum of unitary divisors of n (A034448).
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of function f, defined as f(n) = -A323166(n) = -n when n is one of unitary multiply-perfect numbers (A327158), otherwise f(n) = A323166(n) = gcd(n,A034448(n))
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..87360
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A034448(n) = { my(f=factorint(n)); prod(k=1, #f~, 1+(f[k, 1]^f[k, 2])); }; \\ After code in A034448
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 28 2019
